channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: From @WSJopinion: America is overflowing with people suffering from a broad range of mental disturbance, writes @DanHenninger. Mental illness is the U.S.’s next pandemic. https://t.co/EGZ5J7v4hx
Manchester City clinched its fourth Premier League championship in five years after rallying to beat Aston Villa on the final day of the season. https://t.co/woHLAbnesC
Come work for us, and we’ll build you a house: companies from Disney to JBS are constructing housing in a bid to attract and retain employees https://t.co/3jFz9uUVc4
From @WSJopinion: Something is shifting. Many who backed Donald Trump don’t follow his lead or want him to run in 2024, writes @Peggynoonannyc. https://t.co/1vzarFArXP
U.S. military and diplomatic officials are weighing plans to send special forces troops to Kyiv to guard the newly reopened embassy there, officials said https://t.co/2NtDviHzzn

Rep. Henry Cuellar, the only remaining House Democrat who opposes abortion, is facing a close primary runoff in Texas against immigration attorney Jessica Cisneros, a 28-year-old who once interned for him. https://t.co/glq1Wvz6Dl

The CEO of Abbott Laboratories apologized Saturday for his company’s role in the nationwide shortage of baby formula and promised production will ramp up again in June: “We’re sorry to every family we’ve let down." https://t.co/Z6qsjf8wWA

President Biden said the U.S. is looking into the availability of vaccines that could help prevent the spread of monkeypox: “They haven’t told me the level of exposure yet, but it is something that everybody should be concerned about." https://t.co/pQ9PTXGztD

Cases of monkeypox, rarely found outside certain parts of West and Central Africa, have been reported in several countries across Europe, and also detected in Canada, Australia and the U.S. https://t.co/VqS8JsLw9M

“Don’t come here with your Lamborghinis or your Rolls-Royces." Lake communities in Montana and Idaho are commanding Cartier-like real-estate prices, as West Coast buyers move in. https://t.co/xSYTaMaBUM

In a surprise visit to Kyiv, Polish President Andrzej Duda said that only Ukraine should decide any terms upon which it pursues peace with Moscow, and called for a complete removal of all Russian troops https://t.co/CpnAMjpdKF
Small-business owners are flashing warning signs on the U.S. economy: ‘We are just trying to get through the next couple of weeks’ https://t.co/NnO9pJTOJB
The Lincoln Memorial, dedicated 100 years ago this month, took time to grow into one of America’s most important national symbols. https://t.co/6V7z4F9Nux
After months of legal wrangling, a state judge signed off on a New York state congressional map that largely favors Republicans and creates a new seat in New York City https://t.co/VYE8BYJI4g
From @WSJopinion: Ukrainians are fighting for their lives and their nation, and for the free world. Let it not be as a proxy, but as a partner, writes @Kasparov63. https://t.co/tVx8Uxewro

Poland’s president arrived in Kyiv, where he is slated to become the first foreign leader to address the Ukrainian parliament since Russia invaded, as Russian forces continued pressing their eastern offensive https://t.co/yQonh4Obv3
Americans seeking ideal retirement spots have zeroed in on 162 rural counties. Here’s what they found: Outdoor activities. Lower Taxes. Vibrant Economies. https://t.co/TiIcwCEJb1
Stock investors are positioning for a recession https://t.co/8X6buUv907
To hold down a job these days, a worker seemingly needs one essential trait: a pulse https://t.co/jdTqlgd9iR
No one wins a trade war, economists say, and the one fought by the U.S. and China has been costly to both. Yet there is one clear beneficiary: Vietnam. https://t.co/1RXMXx9wOc
Sanctions are hitting Russian families at the grocery store, amid inflation that is running at double the rate of the West https://t.co/gpLSgY0rs3
Peloton is building a massive factory in Ohio that it will never use—a sign of how the once-hot brand both misjudged demand and made a bad bet on manufacturing https://t.co/vFGTpKdLSR

Tracy Letts on doing nothing: “In this fast-paced culture, where there are always screens in front of us, we miss out on daydreaming and letting the mind go where it wants for ideas and discoveries.” https://t.co/nr4I5667c7
What did Warner Bros. Discovery's new CEO do in his first month in charge? Killed CNN+, questioned a Clint Eastwood movie, laid off much of the key leadership. https://t.co/wubYv951oA
Watch: Intermittent fasting can help improve focus and brain health for animals, studies show. We explain how some of these cognitive benefits can also apply to humans. https://t.co/VmQDIOwpwq
J.M. Smucker issued a voluntary recall of some of its Jif peanut butter products after possible salmonella contamination was traced to its Kentucky plant https://t.co/1xpMW3I0Gu
As stocks tumble, families are watching investments they meant for down payments, tuition or retirement shrink day by day. “I don’t want to go back to work at 66.” https://t.co/2v2Bvf0gKu
Congratulations, you've hired someone to fill that open job. Next challenge is to get that person to actually show up. https://t.co/7xdKstXq4p
The number of U.S. residents in Portugal climbed by 45% last year. Here's what to know about why so many Americans are making the country their home base. https://t.co/qKPnE2oCaF
From @WSJopinion: Something is shifting. Many who backed Donald Trump don’t follow his lead or want him to run in 2024, writes @Peggynoonannyc. https://t.co/BS9436OIx6

The risk of electricity shortages is rising throughout the U.S. And electric-grid operators are warning of rolling blackouts during heat waves or other peak periods as soon as this year. https://t.co/T2vvcPb3zM

Apple has told some of its contract manufacturers that it wants to boost production outside China, citing Beijing’s strict anti-Covid policy among other reasons, people involved in the discussions said https://t.co/cNMFObsAFE
Kaitlyn Younger applied to five Ivy League schools, plus Stanford and Berkeley, with a 1550 on her SAT. None accepted her. https://t.co/oDm56xJVMo
Stock investors are positioning for a recession https://t.co/bATcybQx75
TikTok brain is real, researchers say, and it’s affecting kids’ cognitive development. "We’ve made kids live in a candy store." https://t.co/yHUqolcg2Q
A 200-foot-long wildlife overpass under construction in Los Angeles aims to help the long-term survival of mountain lions and other animals. https://t.co/rTW6gUYUKm
Researchers at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology say they have found a potent new tool in the fight against global warming. It is basically cat litter. https://t.co/Optem85oqv

A Florida appeals court reinstated a congressional map approved by Republican Gov. Ron DeSantis, blocking a lower court order that struck down the map because it split up a plurality Black district in the northern part of the state https://t.co/cfmIAa3Na7
Miami locals say they're fed up with relocating New Yorkers driving up apartment rent https://t.co/aoG2ai3Bca
A handful of anonymous crypto investors profited from inside knowledge of when tokens would be listed on exchanges https://t.co/Hgr3r1yltL
“We knew that if we slowed down or looked back, we could be killed.” Ukrainian families risked their lives rather than spend another day under Russian occupation. https://t.co/EKSE8dLz2s
Essay: No one wins a trade war, economists say, and the one fought by the U.S. and China has been costly to both. Yet there is one clear beneficiary: Vietnam. https://t.co/fV86DhzJb7
A private collector purchased a rare 1955 Mercedes-Benz for $142 million, making it the most expensive car ever sold at auction https://t.co/JIhQGfMyWP
The world’s largest contract chip maker is considering building a semiconductor factory in Singapore to help address a global supply shortage https://t.co/SPCUCETBkg
Here is an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal's weekend edition https://t.co/LN1qpRpP25 https://t.co/9edphX94kW
Boeing Starliner spacecraft successfully docked with the International Space Station, an important milestone on a test mission where the vehicle faced some technical issues. https://t.co/vhPZxcQ1ND
The Lincoln Memorial, dedicated 100 years ago this month, took time to grow into one of America’s most important national symbols. https://t.co/ThkPX4IG6q
More business schools are venturing into virtual reality, using video delivered via headsets to immerse students in far-flung locales https://t.co/8s6pgskLds
Old Navy made a big bet on inclusive sizes; it backfired. The chain ended up with too many XS and XL clothes, and too few of the rest. https://t.co/aVqvAU8BK2

The two sons of former Panama President Ricardo Martinelli were sentenced to three years in prison on Friday for their role in a bribery scheme involving the Brazilian construction giant Odebrecht https://t.co/kQIcWHCJM6
